plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title High-level Deployment Architecture (Flask on EKS)

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

actor "End User" as user

cloud "AWS" as aws {
  node "Amazon EKS Cluster" as eks {
    node "Kubernetes Nodes\n(EC2 worker nodes / managed node group)" as nodes {
      node "Kubernetes Deployment\ncalculator-flask\nreplicas: 6" as deploy {
        artifact "Container Image\nPython + Flask\n(yash5090/calculator-flask:latest\nOR ghcr.io/<org>/<image>)" as image
        component "Flask Web App\nListens on :5000" as app
        image --> app : runs
      }
    }

    node "Kubernetes Service\nType: LoadBalancer\nPort 5000" as svc
  }

  node "AWS Load Balancer\n(provisioned via Service annotations)" as alb
}

node "CI/CD" as cicd {
  component "GitHub Actions\n(docker-image.yml, docker-publish.yml)" as gha
  component "Jenkins Pipeline\n(Jenkinsfile)" as jenkins
  component "Quality & Security Scans\nSonarQube, Trivy,\nOWASP Dependency-Check,\nDocker Scout" as scans
  jenkins --> scans : runs
}

database "Container Registry\nDocker Hub / GHCR" as registry

user --> alb : HTTPS
alb --> svc : forwards
svc --> app : HTTP :5000

gha --> registry : build & push image
jenkins --> registry : build & push image
registry --> deploy : image pull

note right of eks
Terraform folder present (AWS provider v5.x)
No .tf files in repo, so infra details
beyond EKS/LB are not determinable.
end note

@enduml

architecture_description:
## High-level architecture

### Runtime / serving path
- **Client (End User)** accesses the application over **HTTPS**.
- Traffic terminates at an **AWS Load Balancer** that is **automatically provisioned** by Kubernetes because the app is exposed via a **Service type `LoadBalancer`** and includes AWS load balancer annotations.
- The load balancer forwards traffic to the **Kubernetes Service (port 5000)** inside an **Amazon EKS cluster**.
- The Service routes requests to Pods managed by a **Kubernetes Deployment** running **6 replicas** of the application.
- Each Pod runs a **containerized Python/Flask web application** listening on **port 5000**.

### Build, security, and delivery (CI/CD)
- **GitHub Actions** workflows build and publish the Docker image (docker-image.yml / docker-publish.yml).
- A **Jenkins pipeline** (Jenkinsfile) can also build/push images and run security/quality tooling:
  - **SonarQube** (code quality)
  - **Trivy** (container/image scanning)
  - **OWASP Dependency-Check** (dependency vulnerability scanning)
  - **Docker Scout** (image insights/vulns)
- Built images are pushed to a **container registry** (Docker Hub: `yash5090/calculator-flask:latest` and/or **GHCR**).
- The EKS Deployment **pulls the image** from the registry during rollout.

### Infrastructure as Code note
- A Terraform directory exists and indicates the **AWS provider v5.x** is used, but **no `.tf` files** are present in the repository, so the exact AWS resources (VPC, node groups, IAM, etc.) cannot be determined beyond what is implied by the Kubernetes manifests (EKS + AWS LB integration).
